intro: Cuatrecasasiodendron colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian evergreen tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Colombia. It is characterized by its tall stature, reaching up to 30 meters in height, with a straight trunk and a broad, spreading canopy. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small and fragrant, typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces woody fruits containing several seeds. This tree plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
